newsArray.title: IND vs WI: Darren Sammy drops BOMBSHELL ahead of 2nd Test at Arun Jaitley Stadium
creator: Aditya Mallick
newsArray.description: Darren Sammy described West Indies’ Test cricket decline as a deep-rooted "cancer" in the system. He highlighted financial struggles, lack of resources, and player commitment issues as major challenges. Sammy emphasized the need for investment and support to revive the team and honor the region’s rich cricket legacy.The post IND vs WI: Darren Sammy drops BOMBSHELL ahead of 2nd Test at Arun Jaitley Stadium appeared first on News24.

newsArray.title: Sacked For No Reason: Timelines Of Virat Kohli And Rohit Sharma's Sackings As ODI Captain
creator: Rishav Narang
newsArray.description: Three years after Virat Kohli's sudden sacking as the ODI captain, his replacement, Rohit Sharma, met the same fate. Their unceremonius sackings left the fans surprised. Rohit replaced Virat as the ODI captain in December 2021.

creator: Live_Hindustan
newsArray.description: शुभमन गिल के नेतृत्व वाली भारतीय वनडे टीम अगले सप्ताह ऑस्ट्रेलिया के लिए रवाना होगी। विराट कोहली, रोहित शर्मा और श्रेयस अय्यर जैसे खिलाड़ी रवाना होने से पहले टीम से जुड़ेंगे।

newsArray.title: Who is Nashra Sandhu, the bowler behind the viral death stare to India’s captain Harmanpreet Kaur?
creator: ET Online
newsArray.description: Pakistani bowler Nashra Sandhu engaged in a tense moment with Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur during a recent match. Sandhu, a key player for Pakistan, has a strong record in ODIs and T20Is. She also experienced an unusual hit-wicket dismissal at the Women's World Cup. Her performances highlight her significance in the team.

newsArray.title: Jadeja is India’s greatest all-rounder, says Parthiv Patel
creator: Uma Devi
newsArray.description: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel lauded Ravindra Jadeja for his all-round performance in the recently concluded first Test against the West Indies, as the Shubman Gill-led side handed the visitors an innings defeat at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

newsArray.title: From Ashes heartbreak to Women’s ODI World Cup return: On Heather Knight’s ‘lucky’ night against Bangladesh
creator: Rajdeep Saha
newsArray.description: Back in the crease after almost a year, her unbeaten 111-ball 79 after the lifelines saved England’s blushes in a four-wicket win over Bangladesh in a Women’s ODI World Cup league match.
